intro: Eriosema gilletti, commonly known as the silky eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often trifoliate leaves. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silky layer of hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriosema gilletti is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
